definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Creativity is the soul of the advertisement, which endows the advertisement with vitality and life.
sentences.chinese: 创意是广告的灵魂，是赋予广告精神与生命的活动。

sentences.english: Creative Adam and Eve inspired blanket cover for your bed.
sentences.chinese: 受亚当和夏娃所启发的创意毛毯床罩。

sentences.english: For big companies, the idea is simple.
sentences.chinese: 对那些大公司来说，这种创意既简捷又方便。

sentences.english: Please find answers in Creation and Practical Techniques in Ruching Styling.
sentences.chinese: 请从《褶饰造型的创意与实操技法》一文中找寻答案。

sentences.english: I pride myself on always thinking outside the box.
sentences.chinese: 我以自己常具创意革新的思维而感到自豪。

sentences.english: But when you start control creativity, then it starts to feel like doing labor.
sentences.chinese: 但当你开始控制创新时，创意也感觉像做苦力。

sentences.english: Creative sketchbook allows you to draw websites and web apps.
sentences.chinese: 很有创意的速写册，可供你画出网址和网页应用软件。

sentences.english: One of the best resumes we've seen, made on a T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们见过的最具创意的简历之一，体恤衫。

sentences.english: A | It is certainly a great way to monetize a community.
sentences.chinese: 它当然会成为这样一个社区内一个了不起的创意。

sentences.english: Nike Inc. had a "creative community" for sharing creative works.
sentences.chinese: 耐克公司则通过“创意社区”共享“创意作品”。

sentences.english: Nike Inc. had a "creative community" for sharing creative works.
sentences.chinese: 耐克公司则通过“创意社区”共享“创意作品”。

sentences.english: Do you ever wonder what makes a person creative?
sentences.chinese: 你曾想过是什么东西使得一个人有创意吗？

sentences.english: The number 2 was integrated to show the creativeness of their ideas.
sentences.chinese: 数字2被合并到标志中更好的体现了他们的创意。

sentences.english: Creativity and originality have put Taiwan's music scene ahead.
sentences.chinese: 创意和原创性让台湾歌坛发展持续向前进。

sentences.english: He always has some new ideas about the advertising of new product.
sentences.chinese: 对于新产品的广告设计，他总是会有新的创意。

sentences.english: She is intelligent in business with creative mind.
sentences.chinese: 甚具商业头脑，饶富创意有才华。

definition: imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas
to blow people's minds with highly imaginative, bizarre ideas
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
inspiration/insight/a burst of creativity in scientific or artistic endeavor
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
like a heavenly steed, soaring across the skies (idiom)/(of writing, calligraphy etc) bold and imaginative/unconstrained in style
to design/to plot/to plan out/to compose/to draw a mental sketch/conception/plan/idea/composition
